author: Christian Jacinto
title: Tigers eye lead
text:
2 p.m. – Ateneo vs Adamson 4 p.m. – UST vs National University 
If there’s one thing University of Santo Tomas has proven this season – it’s that there’s no safe lead when you’re playing the Tigers. 
But UST coach Bong dela Cruz hopes that his squad starts strong for a change and not see his team fall into an early hole again as they look to hit two birds with one stone today against National University. 
The Tigers seek revenge against the Bulldogs to get a piece of the leadership in the UAAP basketball tournament. 
Game time is at 4 p.m. at the Mall of Asia Arena, a welcome development for the media who are covering the league. 
The Tigers have earned the nickname ‘Comeback Cats’ after showing time and time again that they can storm back from double-digit deficits. 
Their latest victims was De La Salle Sunday as UST rallied from an 11-point deficit to win , 81-79, and improve to 7-1. 
Dela Cruz knows, however,.that they cannot pull off a Houdini everytime. 
“Sana next game, hindi na kami come from behind. Kung lalamang kami sana dire-diretso na,” said Dela Cruz who may have vengeance in his mind against NU. 
“Sila yung talo namin na isa; gagawin lang namin i-correct yung mistakes namin against them and we will prepare.” One guy who was hurt deeply by that loss was UST center Karim Abdul. 
Abdul got thoroughly outplayed by his foreign counterpart in Alfred Aroga in the fourth period. This included the go-ahead fade-away jumper byt Aroga as the Bulldogs scored their first victory in the tournament. 
“That shot hurt me so much. I’m gonna make sure he doesn’t do that again. I’m gonna correct my mistakes and I’m gonna get myself ready this week,” Abdul said. 
In the first game, Ateneo looks to keep hold of the fourth spot as it takes on league-doormat Adamson. 
This will be the first game of Ateneo after Blue Eagles coach Bo Perasol publicly stated that he won’t be returning next year – regardless of what happens. 
Both teams are coming off losses: the Eagles against Far Eastern U, 66-61, and Adamson against UP, 89-84.
